page.title: 07Industry In Our Area.
page.content: Up until the last war the cotton indusry dominated life in our area. Over the next two decades there was a massive decline in this industry due mainly to cheaper imported cotton goods from overseas.Many mills closed down and there was much unemployment. The famous saying 'England's bread hangs on Lancashire's thread' no longer was true. Some former mills, previously engaged in cotton, are now producing other things e.g.jute, industrial containers,or employed in light engineering. One firm, Fothergill and Harvey, did not close down.Fortunately for our area they had seen the light-and diversified.This firm is so important to our area-we visited it to find out what they produce and why they survived.
